dct:title: US Public Housing Developments
dct:creator: Department of Housing and Urban Development
dct:publisher: Office of Policy Development and Research
dct:description:
Denotes the general position of Public Housing Developments by providing the location of the building with the largest number of units in a Development’s community.

HUD furnishes technical and professional assistance in planning, developing and managing these developments. Public Housing Developments are depicted as a distinct address chosen to represent the general location of an entire Public Housing Development, which may be comprised of several buildings scattered across a community. The building with the largest number of units is selected to represent the location of the development.
prov:action:
#########
# GDSC ETL is performed in two steps: shell script to ETL data into postgres
# and then additional transformations with SQL in postGIS (if needed).
####

#########
# Step 1 - bash script (pseudo code)
####

# create directory structure and move into it
mkdir -p /data/mdc_public_housing/{download,etl} && cd /data/mdc_public_housing

# set update flag based on last update and update frequency
do_update=0 if date() < last_update + update_frequency else do_update = 1

# download if update flag is set:
if do_update == 1 then
  wget -O download/mdc_public_housing.json 'https://services.arcgis.com/VTyQ9soqVukalItT/arcgis/rest/services/Public_Housing_Developments/FeatureServer/0/query?outFields=*&where=1%3D1&outSR=4326&f=geojson'

# replace column names Shape__Length and Shape__Area to avoid conflict when
# providing as service on ArcServer.
sed -i 's/Shape__Length/shape_length/gI; s/Shape__Area/shape_area/gI' download/mdc_public_housing.json

# load into postGIS with:
  ogr2ogr -lco GEOMETRY_NAME=geom -f PostgreSQL PG:"<postgres connection>" download/mdc_public_housing.json -nlt point -nln mdc_public_housing

#########
# Step 2 - SQL script (pseudo code):
####

# remove duplicate points and make geometries valid:
UPDATE mdc_public_housing
  SET geom=ST_MakeValid(ST_RemoveRepeatedPoints(geom));"

# add local geometry column and reproject existing geometries into local EPSG:
SELECT AddGeometryColumn (
  'mdc_public_housing',
  'geom_local',2236,'point',2
);
UPDATE mdc_public_housing
  SET geom_local=ST_MakeValid(ST_RemoveRepeatedPoints(ST_Transform(geom,2236)));
CREATE INDEX mdc_public_housing_geom_local_idx
  ON mdc_public_housing
  USING GIST (geom_local);
NOTIFY pgrst, 'reload schema';"cd /data/mdc_public_housing/
mkdir -p derived
# Create pg_dump and downloadable zip of table in derivate directory 
pg_dump -d $POSTGRES_DB -U $POSTGRES_USER -p $POSTGRES_PORT -h postgis-p5hguvsgv3a84juh -t mdc_public_housing > derived/mdc_public_housing.sql
tar -czf derived/mdc_public_housing.sql.tar.gz meta_dcat_mdc_public_housing.json -C derived mdc_public_housing.sql
dcat:contactPoint: University of Miami Libraries, Frost Institute for Data Science and Computing
gdsc:label: project_name
